items.title: In the smouldering wreckage of the Coalition, rumours are running rife
items.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

items.title: 'Insulting': Starmer demands apology after Trump says NATO troops dodged front line
items.description: Donald Trump criticised NATO during a Fox News interview on Thursday, saying the US had "never needed" the alliance.

items.title: Trump forces Europe to reconsider its security and economic future
items.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

items.title: US sends copycat drones to the Middle East to 'flip script' on Iran
items.description: The US copied Iran's Shahed 136 drone. Now, as Donald Trump threatens military action against the regime, analysts say the US could soon use Iran's weapons technology against it.

items.title: Manhunt for alleged triple murderer in regional NSW enters third day
items.description: The search for a gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West enters a third day.

items.title: De Minaur reveals what's adding 'more fire to the belly' at Aus Open
items.description: Alex de Minaur is back in familiar territory, on the cusp of the Australian Open quarterfinals, but he is adamant he can make a deeper run at Melbourne Park than his previous appearances.

items.title: Anxious wait continues for families as New Zealand landslide search enters third day
items.description: Authorities have vowed to continue searching for those missing in the disaster, as officials announce an official review into the incident.

items.title: Dingoes 'not likely' to have caused Canadian teen's death, autopsy reveals
items.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds dingo bites are not likely to have caused the death of Piper James on K'gari.

items.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers cruise into BBL decider
items.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

items.title: Track temperatures live as heatwave sweeps across Australia
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Luana forms into category one system off Kimberley coast
items.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

items.title: Track Cyclone Luana live as it crosses WA coast
items.description: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Luana and monitor wind speeds as the system approaches the WA coast.

items.title: What's behind the masks and runes of Neo-Nazis?
items.description: Viking symbols and a Norwegian jacket have now become synonymous with Australia's Neo-Nazi groups, but what do they mean?

items.title: 'Playbook comes from slave catchers': The terrifying reality of evading ICE in Minnesota
items.description: Reverend Ashley Horan lives one block from where Renee Good was shot and killed and by ICE agents. She and her neighbours have been tracking ICE's movements around Minneapolis.

items.title: Ukraine, Russia and US delegations meet for trilateral talks on peace deal
items.description: The Abu Dhabi talks mark the first known trilateral meeting between the countries since Moscow launched its invasion of Ukraine more than four years ago.

items.title: In a London court, Prince Harry is out to slay dragons — but will it bring peace?
items.description: The Duke of Sussex takes on the publisher he believes poisoned his childhood, his marriage, and his peace of mind in a legal battle driven by anger as well as principle.

items.title: Hottest 100 quiz: How well do you remember past countdowns?
items.description: While you wait to hear who is number one this year, test your memory of past Hottest 100 countdowns.

items.title: Aussie Under-19s finish World Cup group stage unbeaten with record win
items.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

items.title: Lawyers request AFP probe into Israeli president as Australian visit looms
items.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

items.title: Paris Hilton brings sex tape story to Washington for AI porn fight
items.description: The party girl turned anti-abuse advocate throws her glamorous celebrity heft behind a push to tackle deepfake pornography.

items.title: New passport rules designed to improve national security, UK government says
items.description: The requirement for dual British citizens to have a valid UK passport while entering the country would help prevent the arrival of people who present a threat, Australia's British High Commission says.

items.title: These maps show why the US is obsessed with Greenland and its Arctic neighbours
items.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

items.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
items.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

items.title: West Coast Eagles' Tyler Brockman charged over Geraldton street fight
items.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

items.title: Extended police stop-and-search declaration unlawful, court finds
items.description: The Federal Court has found a Victoria Police move to give officers greater powers in Melbourne's CBD for six months was invalid and unlawful.
